title: NTF Gaming
description: 今のNTFのゲームは低品質なので...。

f6_assessments.q0: While I agree that the idea presented in the proposal is a good one, it seems too general to effectively address the challenge. The proposer could add some more details, perhaps to describe what kind of games and how they could use NFTs in a compelling way. This would help future proposers when submitting proposals relating to NFT gaming. Also, proofreading and fixing typos would help strengthen the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not present a plan for building an NFT game business which utilizes the Cardano blockchain. To improve their proposal, they could use an existing NFT game on another blockchain and describe how that could be adapted to Cardano, or perhaps a popular game that does not use blockchain tech and explain how it could utilize NFTs.
f6_assessments.q2: There's no way to measure the increase in the quality of proposals related to NFT gaming by the information provided in the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: I would like the problem statement and solution to be expanded, at the moment it is very broad. NFT Gaming can deliver value to the Cardano ecosystem but I am unclear how this project will be implemented and as such I am unclear how this project will deliver value to the ecosystem. I believe this was more of a call to action than a implementable proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: No timeline, budget, or detailed implementable plan was presented as the proposal is a "call to action" and not a project.
f6_assessments.q2: No metrics or KPIs was presented as the proposal is a "call to action" and not a project. Thus this proposal can not be audited.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem described is very vague, it would be important to provide an adequate rationale for the problem and an appropriate context for the problem.

Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess impact. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess feasibility. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess auditability. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Since the goal of this challenge is "NFT Business Model" on Cardano, this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge. I very much agree with the idea behind the proposal in question but this is not a development proposal but mostly a request. The idea is in line with the challenge but no development plan is presented.  A detailed plan should be presented, as well as what to want and how to do it. The statement of which problem needs to be solved and how it is to be solved remains vague.
f6_assessments.q1: The idea is valid. The proposal identifies the problem within the challenge that needs to be solved but does not clearly explain how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and how this will be done. The plan is not present but it is referred to others who develop it. It would have been nice to see this prototype mentioned as already written
f6_assessments.q2: I would like to advise you to try to elaborate the plan again perhaps by contacting game developers and game designers to try to brainstorm this video game as the idea if developed in an articulated way could be very valid since NFT-based games are currently very simplified.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal doesn't provide specific examples of what makes current NFT games "low quality" or how using NFTs on Cardano will address that issue.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer clearly states that they do not have the experience to make the proposal a reality.
f6_assessments.q2: Again, a list of problems with current NFT-based games would be helpful, and metrics that would prove a new game was more enjoyable, such as low churn rates, hours played per month, active users, growth rates, etc.

f6_assessments.q0: Not a proposal, should be archived
f6_assessments.q1: Not a proposal, should be archived
f6_assessments.q2: Not a proposal, should be archived
